file.name: emMon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: zoomisc
field.variable: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso). Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

file.name: SImon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: siu
field.variable: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

field.name: sndmasssnf
field.variable: mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area
snow mass change through snow fall

field.name: siflswutop
field.variable: the upward shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)
Upward shortwave flux over sea ice

field.name: sifllatstop
field.variable: the net latent heat flux over sea ice
Net latent heat flux over sea ice

field.name: sidmasstrany
field.variable: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

field.name: siv
field.variable: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

field.name: siconc
field.variable: Area fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice

field.name: sipr
field.variable: mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sidmassgrowthbot
field.variable: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area.
sea-ice mass change through basal growth

field.name: simass
field.variable: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sistryubot
field.variable: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice
Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

field.name: sialb
field.variable: Mean surface albedo of entire ice-covered part of grid cell

field.name: sihc
field.variable: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water
Sea-ice heat content per unit area

field.name: sisnthick_sosi
field.variable: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)

field.name: simassacrossline
field.variable: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelego = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
Sea mass area flux through straits

field.name: sidmassgrowthwat
field.variable: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth
sea-ice mass change through growth in supercooled open water (aka frazil)

field.name: sistrxubot
field.variable: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice
X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

field.name: sidmasssi
field.variable: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area
sea-ice mass change through snow-to-ice conversion

field.name: sifllwdtop
field.variable: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)
Downwelling longwave flux over sea ice

field.name: sidmassmelttop
field.variable: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area
sea-ice mass change through surface melting

field.name: sitempsnic
field.variable: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero

field.name: sitimefrac
field.variable: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc 0 ) in a grid cell
Fraction of time steps with sea ice

field.name: siflswdtop
field.variable: the downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always positive by sign convention)
Downwelling shortwave flux over sea ice

field.name: sitemptop
field.variable: Surface temperature of sea-ice (surface temperature of snow cover on the sea ice if applicable).

field.name: sisnconc
field.variable: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice.

field.name: sidivvel
field.variable: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)
Divergence of the sea-ice velocity field

field.name: sidmasstranx
field.variable: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

field.name: sivol
field.variable: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

field.name: sicompstren
field.variable: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P*hexp(-C(1-A)))

field.name: sifllwutop
field.variable: the upward longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)
Upward longwave flux over sea ice

field.name: sidmassmeltbot
field.variable: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area
sea-ice mass change through bottom melting

field.name: sisnmass
field.variable: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: siflsenstop
field.variable: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice
Net sensible heat flux over sea ice

field.name: sidmassevapsubl
field.variable: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area
sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation

field.name: sndmassmelt
field.variable: the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area

file.name: Omon_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

CMIP6 model data produced by CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France) is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution'Share Alike' 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. The data producers and data providers make no warranty, either express or implied,, including but not limited to, warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: mlotstmax
field.variable: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

field.name: hfbasinpadv
field.variable: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin. Use Celsius for temperature scale.
northward ocean heat transport due to parameterized eddy advection

field.name: tauucorr
field.variable: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

field.name: vo
field.variable: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

field.name: masso
field.variable: Total mass of liquid seawater. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

field.name: wfo
field.variable: computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum of the next two variables in this table.

field.name: tauvo
field.variable: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

field.name: obvfsq
field.variable: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water
Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water

field.name: tos
field.variable: this may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice.

field.name: msftyzsmpa
field.variable: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
ocean Y overturning mass streamfunction due to parameterized submesoscale advection

field.name: msftmrho
field.variable: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

field.name: hfbasinpsmadv
field.variable: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin. Use Celsius for temperature scale.
northward ocean heat transport due to parameterized submesoscale advection

field.name: msftyyz
field.variable: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

field.name: agessc
field.variable: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.
Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact

field.name: zostoga
field.variable: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change

field.name: thetao
field.variable: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.name: msftbarot
field.variable: Streamfunction or its approximation for free surface models. See OMDP document for details.

field.name: sfriver
field.variable: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content. Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

field.name: uo
field.variable: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

field.name: pso
field.variable: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface
Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface

field.name: msftyzmpa
field.variable: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection". Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
ocean Y overturning mass streamfunction due to parameterized mesoscale advection

field.name: bigthetao
field.variable: Sea water conservative temperature (this should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field)

field.name: cfc11
field.variable: Moles Per Unit Mass of CFC-11 in Sea Water
Moles Per Unit Mass of CFC-11 in Sea Water

field.name: mlotst
field.variable: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

field.name: msftmzsmpa
field.variable: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction due to parameterized submesoscale advection

field.name: masscello
field.variable: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

field.name: msftyrhompa
field.variable: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection". Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
ocean Y overturning mass streamfunction due to parameterized mesoscale advection

field.name: hfds
field.variable: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .
Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

field.name: mlotstmin
field.variable: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

field.name: thetaoga
field.variable: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field
Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature

field.name: wfcorr
field.variable: Positive flux implies correction adds water to ocean.

field.name: vmo
field.variable: Y-ward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.

field.name: wfonocorr
field.variable: computed as the water flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Water Flux into Sea Water Without Flux Correction

field.name: msftmrhompa
field.variable: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection". Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction due to parameterized mesoscale advection

field.name: msftmyz
field.variable: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

field.name: hfbasin
field.variable: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

field.name: hfbasinpmadv
field.variable: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin. Use Celsius for temperature scale.
northward ocean heat transport due to parameterized mesoscale advection

field.name: hfbasinpmdiff
field.variable: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.
northward ocean heat transport due to parameterized mesoscale diffusion

field.name: tob
field.variable: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.
Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor

field.name: tauuo
field.variable: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

field.name: bigthetaoga
field.variable: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature

field.name: zos
field.variable: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

field.name: tosga
field.variable: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice.This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice.For models using conservative temperature as prognostic field, they should report the SST as surface potent

field.name: umo
field.variable: X-ward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.

field.name: msftmzmpa
field.variable: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection". Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
ocean meridional overturning mass streamfunction due to parameterized mesoscale advection

field.name: wmo
field.variable: Upward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.

field.name: msftyrho
field.variable: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

field.name: pbo
field.variable: Sea Water Pressure at Sea floor
Sea Water Pressure at Sea floor

field.name: sob
field.variable: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell
sea water salinity at sea floor

field.name: tauvcorr
field.variable: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

field.name: hfsifrazil
field.variable: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Frazil Ice Formation
Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Frazil Ice Formation

field.name: fsitherm
field.variable: computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Water Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

field.name: sfdsi
field.variable: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux

field.name: ph
field.variable: negative log of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

field.name: talk
field.variable: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, nitrogen, silicate, and borate components)

field.name: talknat
field.variable: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

field.name: fgco2
field.variable: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)

field.name: expc100
field.variable: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon at 100m
Downward Flux of Particle Organic Carbon

field.name: dissicnat
field.variable: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

field.name: dfe
field.variable: Dissolved iron in sea water, including both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not particulate detrital iron)

field.name: fgo2
field.variable: Gas exchange flux of O2 (positive into ocean)

field.name: intpp
field.variable: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton. This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.
Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton

field.name: chl
field.variable: Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations. In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration and Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration

field.name: spco2
field.variable: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2

file.name: fx_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here

field.name: hfgeou_sea
field.variable: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

field.name: sftof
field.variable: This is the area fraction at the ocean surface.

file.name: SIday_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past

CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: sispeed
field.variable: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice

field.name: sithick
field.variable: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

file.name: Oyr_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past

field.variable: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components) at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

field.name: omldamax
field.variable: Mean Daily Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Mixing Scheme

field.name: vsi
field.variable: "Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice."

field.name: sic
field.variable: fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice.

field.name: usi
field.variable: "Reported as ""missing"" in regions free of sea ice."

CNRM (Centre National de Recherches Meteorologiques, Toulouse 31057, France), CERFACS (Centre Europeen de Recherche et de Formation Avancee en Calcul Scientifique, Toulouse 31100, France)

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: tossq
field.variable: square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

field.name: tos
field.variable: this may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice.

field.name: deptho
field.variable: Ocean bathymetry. Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.

field.name: cpocean
field.variable: A global constant used to convert between temperature flux and heat flux, and to compute heat content of sea water.

field.name: areacello
field.variable: Horizontal area of ocean grid cells

field.name: masscello
field.variable: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

field.name: rhozero
field.variable: Relevant only for Boussinesq ocean models

file.name: Odec_historical_CNRM-CM6-1_r1i1p1f1_TBD_%start_date%_%end_date%
file.variable: all-forcing simulation of the recent past

Use of the data should be acknowledged following guidelines found at https://pcmdi.llnl.gov/home/CMIP6/citation.html.Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via the further_info_url(recorded as a global attribute in data files)[ and at http://www.umr-cnrm.fr/cmip6/]. All liabilities arising from the supply of the information (including any liability arising in negligence) are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

A character string containing a list of published or web-based references that describe the data or the methods used to produce it.Typically, the user should provide references describing the modelformulation here
CNRM-CM6-1 model output prepared for CMIP6 / CMIP historical
Start date chosen so that variant r1i1p1f1 has the better fit with Krakatoa impact on tos

field.name: masso
field.variable: Total mass of liquid seawater. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

field.name: wfo
field.variable: computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum of the next two variables in this table.

field.name: thetaoga
field.variable: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field
Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature

field.name: tauuo
field.variable: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

field.name: thetao
field.variable: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.name: hfbasin
field.variable: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

field.name: tos
field.variable: this may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice.

field.name: bigthetaoga
field.variable: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Global Average Sea Water Conservative Temperature

field.name: tosga
field.variable: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice.This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice.For models using conservative temperature as prognostic field, they should report the SST as surface potent

field.name: uo
field.variable: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

field.name: agessc
field.variable: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.
Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact

field.name: tauvo
field.variable: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

field.name: sfriver
field.variable: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content. Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

field.name: msftmyz
field.variable: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

field.name: vo
field.variable: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

field.name: hfds
field.variable: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .
Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface

field.name: sfdsi
field.variable: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
